availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Overstreet (Overton County, Tennessee, farmer, merchant and tobacco dealer)

body.p: Overton County, Tennessee, farmer, merchant and tobacco dealer. Tennessee native. Married to Lean Overstreet. Father of William Ambrose Overstreet, Sarah Overstreet, Thomas Lafayette Overstreet, John Overstreet, and Eula Lee Overstreet. Farmer in Overton County, Tennessee, in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Overton County in 1860. Guardian of sixteen enslaved persons for W. W. Overstreet and S. S. Overstreet, in Cumberland County, Kentucky, in 1860. Merchant, tobacco dealer, and partner in trade with S. Taylor in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, District 8, p. 232.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, District 8.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, District 8, p. 342B.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 06, Adair County, Kentucky, 1864.
